data.title: Palladium
data.meta_description: Myrtle Sams, age 83, of Richmond, died Monday, June 29, 2015, at Reid Hospital.
data.text:
Myrtle Sams, age 83, of Richmond, died Monday, June 29, 2015, at Reid Hospital.

Born February 6, 1932, in McKee, Kentucky, to Walter and Lucy Angel Smith, Myrtle lived most of her life in Richmond. She had worked for Gray's Donuts for 16 years and was the owner of Clothing Outlet for 10 years.

Survivors include her daughters, Judy Downing of Richmond and Janet (Michael) Sparks of Zionsville, Indiana; sons, Doug and Roger Sams, both of Richmond; grandchildren, Rhonda, Michelle, Kevin, Roger Jr., Devon, Jessica, and Matt; 9 great-grandchildren; 8 great-great grandchildren; sister, Joyce Crowl of McKee, Kentucky; brothers, Bill Smith and Keith Smith, both of McKee, Kentucky, and Phillip Smith of Arizona; nieces; nephews; and many friends.

She was preceded in death by her husband of 48 years, Jesse Sams, who died July 18, 1995; parents; sister, Birdie Sams; and brother, Leon Smith.

Visitation for Myrtle Sams will be from 6 to 8:00 p.m. Thursday, July 2, 2015, at Doan & Mills Funeral Home, 790 National Road West, Richmond. Funeral service will be at 10:00 a.m. Friday, July 3, 2015, at Doan & Mills Funeral Home. Burial will be in Elkhorn Cemetery.

Condolences may be sent to the family via the guest book at www.doanmillsfuneralhome.com.
